headline: Bolton’s Book Suggests Trump Helped Erdogan and Xi
abstract: Interventions in Justice Department proceedings draw scrutiny after the former national security adviser raised concerns about the president’s embrace of authoritarian leaders.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — It was late 2018, and President Recep Tayyip Erdogan of Turkey was on the phone with an unusual request for President Trump: Could he intervene with top members of his cabinet to curb or even shut down a criminal investigation into Halkbank, one of Turkey’s largest state-owned banks?
keywords: Trump-Ukraine Whistle-blower Complaint and Impeachment Inquiry
